ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Product_specification is a type of Configuration_watched_item that characterizes a product or a set of products in a Product_class by a set of Specifications. A Product_specification identifies a manufacturable object, or expected as so.
A Product_specification is defined with respect to the Product_class it is a member of.
The kind of product that is to be manufactured from the data of the Product_specification, is the kind of product that the item_concept attribute identifies a class of.
The intent of the Product_specification entity is the identification of one manufacturable object whereas the intent of Product_class is the gathering of products with similar characteristics.
The actual set of Specification objects for a Product_specification are obtained by the union of the Specification instances grouped in the defining_specifications attribute and of the Specification instances related to the considered Product_class through a Class_specification_association or a Class_condition_association with association_type 'identification'.
The specification of a Product_specification may be incomplete: there may not be in 'defining_specifications' any instance of Specification for some Specification_category declared as mandatory for the considered Product_class. For these Specification_category objects, any Specification available in the context of the considered Product_class is considered as valid for the manufacturing of the product characterized by the considered Product_specification.
If the colour is not specified for a given product family, the specified product resulting from the realization of a Product_specification associated to the Product_class representing the product family may be without paint or painted in any available colour.

The version_id specifies the version identifier of the Product_specification.
The version_id need not be specified for a particular Product_specification.
The item_context specifies the Product_class that the Product_specification belongs to.
The defining_specification specifies the set of Specification objects necessary to discriminate the Product_specification within its Product_class.

A Specification_based_product_version is a type of Product_version that is defined by a Product_specification.
The Product_specification provides the set of specifications from which the product version shall be designed or manufactured.
The Item_design_association that provides the specification of the Product_version.
The specification_source shall be a Product_specification.
